content: The 56th Annual Meeting of the World Economic Forum will focus on fundamental principles driving trust, including transparency, consistency, and accountability.

The World Economic Forum's Annual Meeting will host over 100 governments, all major international organizations, 1000 Forum Partners, civil society leaders, experts, youth representatives, social entrepreneurs, and news outlets.
The World Economic Forum is defined as the International Organization for Public-Private Cooperation.
The World Economic Forum engages leading political, business, cultural, and other societal figures to shape global, regional, and industry agendas.
The World Economic Forum believes that progress is achieved by uniting individuals from diverse backgrounds who possess the drive and influence to enact positive change.
